page.title: 01DEVIZES,AN INTRODUCTION.
page.content: Devizes is a market town with a population of 11,000 and is one of the oldest boroughs in Wiltshire.Most of Devizes early history centres around the Castle,built on a site where two Manors met,hence Devizes,from the Latin "Ad Divisas," meaning "At the boundaries." For nearly a century it has been a garrison town but due to changes in military structure the last personnel left in 1983.The market and shopping facilities are good and annual events include a carnival,canoe race,and some exchanges related to the Towns of Waiblingen in Germany and Mayenne in France with whom Devizes is twinned. Industry is centered around the brewery and factories manufacturing card products and foodstuffs.The chief source of employment is the large Hospital at Roundway.
